item.title: Educational Displays at the LaPierre Lane Riverway
item.description:
Project Description

The LaPierre Lane Riverway was the first completed trail of the Saranac River Trail Greenway. Located at the end of LaPierre Lane in Morrisonville, NY, the park includes a 1/4 mile hiking trail suitable for all ages and abilities, a youth adventure area with locally crafted and nature-inspired playground equipment, fitness-for-life exercise equipment, a meditation garden and canoe launch on the banks of the Saranac River, and a boardwalk through a forested riparian wetland supporting a wealth of local biodiversity. Since 2017, Dr. Alldred and her students have collaborated with the Town of Plattsburgh to provide educational signage for this park. Signs are updated periodically. Stop by today to learn something new about wetlands!
To learn more about student research related to this project, please visit the Undergraduate Research Projects page.

Tour of the Park

Take a virtual tour of the LaPierre Lane Riverway with Dr. Alldred and Trevor Cole, Senior Planner for the Town of Plattsburgh!

Educational Displays

item.title: Zoom a Microbe
item.description:
Project Description

The best advice I ever received for learning biogeochemistry is that everything makes a lot more sense if you think about it from the point of view of a microbe. But let’s face it, microbes can be hard to relate to. They are foundational to the structure and function of every ecosystem on Earth. But they’re also small, they don’t talk much, and we rarely see them in their own environments. Until now! The Zoom a Microbe series dives below the surface of ecosystems and interview microbes about what they do and why. These videos are designed to be short, entertaining, and hopefully spark a desire to learn more about our fascinating microscopic neighbors.

Meet One of the Microbes!

Meet the microbe who started it all, Didi the Denitrifying Bacterium.

Subscribe to the Dr. Nitrogen Numbers YouTube Channel

If you enjoyed meeting Didi, check out my YouTube Channel. Like and subscribe to stay up to date on the latest microbe interviews.
Dr. Nitrogen Numbers

Collaborators

Dr. Jonathan Borrelli
